docs.lead_paragraph: This dish bakes for an hour, but the fish is well insulated by chard, flavorful tomato sauce and wine.

headline.seo: Halibut, Chard and Potato Casserole — Recipes for Health

docs.snippet: This dish bakes for an hour, but the fish is well insulated by chard, flavorful tomato sauce and wine.

docs.abstract: In more than half of all states, the number of parents opting not to vaccinate their children is rising, a new analysis shows.
docs.snippet: In more than half of all states, the number of parents opting not to vaccinate their children is rising, a new analysis shows.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rather than the centerpiece of prosecution, witness testimony should be viewed more like trace evidence, scientists say, with the same fragility and vulnerability to contamination.

headline.main: The Certainty of Memory Has Its Day in Court
headline.print_headline: The Certainty Of Memory Has Its Day In Court

docs.abstract: Scientists have long cautioned that memory is imprecise, and can easily be altered as time goes on, making witness testimony a fallible tool for use in courtrooms; about 75 percent of DNA-based exonerations have come in cases based on flawed accounts from witnesses; Supreme Court is set to hear first case in more than three decades questioning the validity of using witness testimony.
docs.snippet: Rather than the centerpiece of prosecution, witness testimony should be viewed more like trace evidence, scientists say, with the same fragility and vulnerability to contamination.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study of 28,880 people showed that people who consumed too little sodium were at greater risk for heart problems than people who took in a moderate amount.

headline.seo: For Heart Health, Less Sodium Isn’t Always Better
headline.main: Patterns: Less Salt Isn’t Always Better for the Heart
headline.print_headline: Patterns: Less Salt Isn’t Always Better for the Heart

docs.abstract: Study published in The Journal of the American Medical Association finds people who consume too little sodium are at greater risk for heart problems than those who take in a moderate amount; study is co-authored by Evan R Myers of Duke University.
docs.snippet: A study of 28,880 people showed that people who consumed too little sodium were at greater risk for heart problems than people who took in a moderate amount.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Swedish researchers discovered that clamping a newborn’s umbilical cord after three minutes, rather than 10 seconds, meant the infants had higher iron concentrations in their blood four months later.

headline.seo: Delay in Clamping Umbilical Cord Has Benefits Months Later
headline.main: Childbirth: Benefits Seen in Clamping the Cord Later
headline.print_headline: Childbirth: Benefits Seen in Clamping the Cord Later

docs.abstract: Study published in journal BMJ finds waiting three minutes, rather than 10 seconds, before clamping a newborn's umbilical cord results in much lower incidence of blood iron deficiency four months later; pediatrician Ola Andersson is study's lead author.
docs.snippet: Swedish researchers discovered that clamping a newborn’s umbilical cord after three minutes, rather than 10 seconds, meant the infants had higher iron concentrations in their blood four months later.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that preserving ovaries during hysterectomies may not reduce the risk for osteoporosis, cardiovascular disease and mortality.

headline.seo: Partial Hysterectomies Still Increase Early Menopause Risk

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Obstetrics & Gynecology finds hysterectomies may induce early menopause even when ovaries are left intact; study is co-authored by Evan R Myers of Duke University.
docs.snippet: A new study suggests that preserving ovaries during hysterectomies may not reduce the risk for osteoporosis, cardiovascular disease and mortality.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. William Beaumont’s contribution to medical science was small, but it was unique and made all the more remarkable by his circumstances.

headline.seo: ‘Open Wound’ Book Review - Doctor and Patient, Bound Together
headline.main: Doctor and Patient, Bound by Mutual Dependency
headline.print_headline: Doctor and Patient, Bound by Mutual Dependency

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews book Open Wound: The Tragic Obsession of Dr William Beaumont by Jason Karlawish.
docs.snippet: Dr. William Beaumont’s contribution to medical science was small, but it was unique and made all the more remarkable by his circumstances.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a study in Pakistan, home-treated children had only a 9 percent treatment-failure rate, while children in hospitals failed to improve 18 percent of the time.

headline.seo: Home Care Best for Child Pneumonia in Study
headline.main: Pakistan: Children With Pneumonia Fare Better With Home Treatment, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Pakistan: Children With Pneumonia Fare Better With Home Treatment, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Study published in The Lancet finds Pakistani children with severe pneumonia received more effective treatment at home when cared for by female health workers than they did when their parents took them to the hospital; co-author Donald Thea of Boston University says Pakistan's network of 90,000 female health workers is one of best community-based health systems in the world.
docs.snippet: In a study in Pakistan, home-treated children had only a 9 percent treatment-failure rate, while children in hospitals failed to improve 18 percent of the time.

docs.lead_paragraph: Low levels of the essential vitamin can bring on symptoms including muscle weakness, fatigue, shakiness, unsteady gait, incontinence, low blood pressure and depression.

headline.seo: Vitamin B12 Deficiency Can Cause Symptoms That Mimic Aging
headline.main: It Could Be Old Age, or It Could Be Low B12
headline.print_headline: It Could Be Old Age, or It Could Be Low B12

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column warns that people with vitamin B12 deficiency can exhibit host of symptoms normally associated with age-related maladies, including muscle weakness, fatigue and cognitive dysfunction.
docs.snippet: Low levels of the essential vitamin can bring on symptoms including muscle weakness, fatigue, shakiness, unsteady gait, incontinence, low blood pressure and depression.
